column4: oh man, how the hell do I edit this menu.lst file?? all I can use is cat, echo....
do you have sed by any chance?
that would replace the first instance of lv_root on a line with lvroot
i resized an ext4 partition the other day, which was an extended partition
i think it totally blew away everything else on the logical partition that it was a part of...
i ended up running through fsck for about 2 days fixing things... then i had to back up the data that i could recover, blast away all my linux partitions, and start from scratch. so, be careful
yeah never run fsck or anything like it on a mounted partition, asking for trouble
sure it didn't automount it or something?
i have all of my linux partitions on extended volumes
then install ubuntu and point grub to the windows partition
you need a bootloader to load that iso if you're not going to put it on a cd
i don't think that grub will do it, but i think you can use isolinux or syslinux...
